fields.description:
Hey guys, is there a reason why this file is not updated since the release of 1.10.23.1?

[https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/update/windowsupdates.txt] not updated
fields.summary: Chocolatey not updated because automated trigger file not updated

fields.description:
I found a tip to hover over the file name for a while to know more details about the rename
but I still think this should be way more clearer and easier to find,the whole pane is empty!
why not show something like /path/to/old/file.ext -> new/path/newname.ext
I found a similar issue BSERV-5514 so i created this one for the correct product
fields.summary: better diff for renamed files

fields.description: Animations can become quite annoying when going through changes in the file list. As a poweruser I am not interested in moving dialogs and the code review pane to move.
fields.summary: Option to disable animations

fields.description:
Bitbucket has the very nice feature that it can show the number of commits that each branch is Behind / Ahead of the selected branch. (See screenshot from Bitbucket)

(We use a simple merging strategy where branches are merged into "master" once developed and tested, so the reference branch is almost always master.)

Please add this feature into SourceTree so we can see at a glance where each branch is relative to the selected branch.  (The key feature here is being able to easily identify which branches have been merged (behind) and which haven't (ahead))
fields.summary: Add Branch Behind / Ahead counts

fields.description:
When installing the Windows version (beta / GA), there are reports of errors of a missing Askpass.exe.

Note: The file, Askpass.UI.Wpf.dll, was there.
fields.summary: Missing Askpass.exe within Windows builds

fields.description:
Using SourceTree for Windows v2.0.18.1 (latest)
 This is 100% reproducible.
 I had a co-worker confirm the issue on his machine.
 I'm not sure when this was broken. SourceTree v1.9.10 also shows the issue.
 
 I have a file change in a repo which modifies a line containing the text "EE_UNIT_NUMBER_L" If I search on variations of this term, I get varying results, but none of my searches using "file changes" yield the commit I was looking for.
 EE_UNIT_NUMBER_L shows one of the commits, but not the other.
 NUMBER shows nothing of interest.
 UNIT_NUMBER shows nothing of interest.
 I included a screenshot showing a search for commit messages showing the commit of interest including the diff of what was changed.
 
 Using the terminal, log -G"UNIT_NUMBER" found both commits which modify this string.
 
 See attached screenshots for details.

 

---

 
Upon further investigation, it seems the cause of this is likely a difference in the log -S and log -G commands.  
 See here:
 [https://git-scm.com/docs/git-log#git-log--Sltstringgt]

The "log -S" command returns a result only if the number of occurrences of the search term change.  For example if the search term is moved from one line to another, or something else on the line changed which doesn't add or remove the search term, then the result won't show.  This appears to be why my search in SourceTree turned up empty.  In the terminal, log -S"UNIT_NUMBER" returns the same unhelpful result that SourceTree provided.

The "log -G" command works differently (in addition to supporting regex queries)... "Look for differences whose patch text contains added/removed lines that match"  This means if a line is changed that contains the search term, then it will be included in the results.  

I believe the expectation of the search function for "File Changes" should match the log -G results.
fields.summary: Search function only works if search term is added or removed from a file

fields.description:
the scaling of the icons on the left side bar seem to be broken, see attachment

latest sourcetree on windows10
fields.summary: dpi scaling icons broken

fields.description:
We've detected a number of crashes where libgit2 has failed when trying to read the HEAD of a repository.

If you experience this crash could you please upload any %localappdata%\Atlassian\SourceTree\sourcetree*.log files covering the time of the crash to this issue.

Thanks
fields.summary: Libgit2 crash

fields.description:
SourceTree fails to open a sub-repo. and crashes, whenever this same sub-repo. has an improper "branch" configuration.


Error returned:
System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException: startIndex cannot be larger than length of string.

I started working on my Git repo. straight with SourceTree 2.0, and since then I could not open one of my sub-repositories (main repo. and all sub-repo. retrieved from remote). I ended up using the CLI to interact with it.

The configuration file is at let us say @C:\Git_repo\.git\modules\mySubRepo\config.

+Incorrect configuration:+
[branch "origin/master"]
   remote = .
   merge = refs/heads/master


+Correct configuration (solving the crash):+
[branch "master"]
   remote = origin
   merge = refs/heads/master


I have no clue how/why this configuration was generated this way.

Attached is a modified extract from %localappdata%\SourceTree-settings\beta*.log.
fields.summary: Crash with wrong submodule branch configuration
Project NewWard
Alternative main window of the application

fields.description:
For a user who comes from the command-line it would be easier to use (learn using) SourceTree.
For a user to starts using Git with SourceTree it would be easier to understand how
SourceTree Gui maps to git command-line and lookup online manuals.

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Add an (opt.) window that shows (logs) the git command-line calls.

fields.description:
# In a Git repository with unstaged files, right-click on a file and click "Log selected".
 # The "Log" window should appear maximised. Observe that the window can't be resized or moved. In a a multi-monitor setup it is stuck to one monitor.

There is a way to make the window movable and resizeable:
 # Observe that the icons in the top right of the window initially are "minimise", "maximise", and "close".
 # Click the "maximise" button. Nothing will happen.
 # Click the "minimise" button.
 # Restore the window (e.g. by Alt-Tabbing to it).
 # Observe that the "maximise" button has become a "restore" button. Click it.
 # The window size becomes smaller, and the window can now be resized and moved.

After doing this the window will retain its last size. However, it won't retain its position, so if I drag it to a second monitor, it will always open back up on the first monitor.
fields.summary: Log window can't be resized or moved

fields.description: Our Windows packaging group requires some sort of statement that says SourceTree is supported on Windows 10. We can't find anything about Supported Environments, which surprised me because that is usually listed for other Atlassian products. I've looked through the JIRA issues and it appears as though it should work fine. Is that true?
fields.summary: Is SourceTree supported for Windows 10?

fields.description:
I oftentimes find myself working across clones of the same repository, but in different branches. Once code is working in a branch, I want to commit it locally and then (sometimes) cherrypick that diff over to the other branch.

I currently do this by exporting a patch to disk, but it would be really convenient and much faster to support the clipboard.

For example, instead of having the patch destination be a folder, just have it be the clipboard. And ditto for the patch source - then we'd get super easy sharing of diffs across repos.

This is related to SRCTREE-1564.
fields.summary: Apply patch from clipboard

fields.description:
We have a Powershell script that takes selected commit & repo path as parameters and creates VSTS Pull Requests and updates Jira Tickets
The script is interactive (ie requires user input as it runs)

It would nice to have interactive input allowed for these scripts. Currently, the scripts will just run silently.
fields.summary: Interactive Script in Custom Actions

fields.description: The file log window cannot be resized or moved – the maximize button and dragging/double clicking on the title bar does not appear to do anything. The minimize and close buttons are the only interactions that seem to work.
fields.summary: Log Window cannot be resized or moved
Nothing written to sourcetree.log

fields.description:
When applying a stash, some users would like:
# To be warned if there will be a merge conflict 
# In case there will be a merge conflict, they would like to have the option to cancel (not apply the stash)
fields.summary: As a user I would like SourceTree to warn me if there will be merge conflicts before applying a stash

fields.description:
My repo has > 15000 commits. Using "Jump To | Commit..." to jump to the initial commit takes several minutes.

By contrast, in gitk I can instantly scroll through the entire history.
fields.summary: "Fetching older commits" is incredibly slow
Include "Labels/Tags" in the commit description

fields.description:
I ran into issues comparable to the issue discussed [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-1000].

When I use the "resolve using mine" or "resolve using theirs" functionality in SourceTree, I end up with a file on the local workspace that still contains the conflict markers, as can be seen in the SSIS snippet below:
{code:java}
<SSIS:Property SSIS:Name="Sensitive">0</SSIS:Property>
<<<<<<< HEAD
                <SSIS:Property SSIS:Name="Value">ConnectionStringA;</SSIS:Property>
=======
                <SSIS:Property SSIS:Name="Value">ConnectionStringB;</SSIS:Property>
>>>>>>> hotfix/20170403
                <SSIS:Property SSIS:Name="DataType">18</SSIS:Property>
{code}
As opposed to the other issue I referred to, it's not Visual Studio holding on to an earlier version, as I opened the file in a separate text editor straight from the working folder on the file system. The markers definitely appear in there, rendering the SSIS package entirely corrupt when opened in Visual Studio.
fields.summary: Resolve using theirs on file leaves behind conflict markers

fields.description:
# Edit a file in the repo
 # Switch to Log/History 
 # Press F5 - the file appears in Unstaged Files
 # Switch to File Status

The changed file is not shown Unstaged Files. I have to press F5 again.

This didn't used to happen, and it doesn't happen in the Mac version.
fields.summary: "Refresh" should update both File Status and Log/History views
Error Log from non-starting Sourcetree

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
- tick "Always display full console output" in Tools>Options>General
- create a Custom Action and leave "Show full output" unticked

Expected behaviour:
-Full output is shown for git Actions and Full output is NOT shown for Custom Actions
Actual behaviour:
-Full output is shown for both git Actions and Custom Actions

Additional Info:
When the General setting is unticked and the Custom-Action setting is ticked, the Full output is NOT shown for Git Actions but shown for Custom-Actions, which is what I would expect.

But it should work the other way round, too, i.e, the setting in Custom Actions always overrides the General setting.
fields.summary: Option "Always display full console output" (General) and "Show full output" (Custom Action) don't play nice together

fields.description: Running the beta version of Source Tree 2.0 the icons in the sidebar showing the branches etc are too large and overlap the the text.
fields.summary: Large icons on UHD monitor with 125% scaling enabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With the latest versions of SourceTree, the application is installed only for the user who performs the installation. Some users would like to install it for all users in the Windows machine.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option to the installer to allow installation for all users.
fields.summary: As a user I want to install SourceTree in a Windows machine for all users

fields.description: In the latest beta, SourceTree stopped watching pending files. To make a commit I have to restart the program, then it lists changed files correctly.
fields.summary: Changing/pending files are not refreshed

fields.description:
*Experienced behaviour:*

When I selected a file to see the changes in it, I only saw empty hunks with line information. I had to click on "File status" and select the file again to see the actual diff of each hunk. (see [^no_changes_sourcetree.jpg]).

 

*Expected behaviour:*

When I select a file, the changes should be shown immediately within the particular hunks.

 

Note:

I was not able to reproduce this issue and it occurred only once. However, I have only been using the new beta for the last hour or two.
fields.summary: Empty diff windows
Windows is a case insensitive OS and rename file test.txt for TeXt.tXt - change isn't detected

fields.description:
{quote}I tried to install sourcetree today, when the application asked for my existing account, it showed google signin, and an empty textbox for the local account.

There is no indication, not even a simple placeholder or a label to state that that textbox accepts a email, as opposed to a username, and this resulted me trying to login more times, and click through the 2 popups that appear when I tried to login. This is really bad user experience.{quote}.
 !image-2017-04-04-18-59-34-767.png|thumbnail! 

This issue seems to happen on IE11 instead of other browsers(Edge, Chrome and Firefox)

-- STSP-6301
fields.summary: AID Login doesn't indicate what information needed to proceed

fields.description:
In the current version, I have bookmarks for the submodules of my repo organised in the bookmark tree. Within this tree I can see in a glance the status of the submodules (changed files, pending merges etc).

This feature makes it easier to handle submodules, as it is already hard enough to cope with them given the complex concept of GIT regarding to submodules.

 

In the beta version, you have removed this possibility (because of space, as I understand). Because of that I don't see the information when I work on the main repository and would have to click through different top-tab pages to see the same information.

 

Please reconsider and make the bookmark bar available again (optional). It would be enough to display the bookmarks of the folder the repo was opened from, a tree (as in the current bookmarks) is not essential for my use case.
fields.summary: Removal of repository bookmark sidebar makes it hard to work with submodules

fields.description:
In Tools, Options, General tab, there's an option: Refresh automatically when files change option.

You can switch it on: now SourceTree constantly takes up an entire CPU while building code, slowing things down. This drives Antimalware Service Executable nuts (even when there's a sourcetree.exe exclusion set for it...), so that uses another CPU, making things worse.

You can switch it off: now you need to remember to press F5 to see the latest status.

There should be a third option: have SourceTree refresh only when it gains focus. Then you can leave it in the background doing nothing, and when you switch to it you get an automatic refresh of the git status.
fields.summary: Option to refresh when gaining focus

fields.description:
With a number of outstanding changes in the staging view, when the view refreshes (either automatically or by pressing F5), the files listed will both reorder themselves seemingly randomly, and occasionally one of the files will disappear from the staging view. Refreshing again will generally bring the file back, but will occasionally hide a different file.

If any actions are taken for all files such as stage all, the hidden file will not be included, potentially leading to incomplete commits or other important operations.

This would be a complete showstopper for getting the rest of my team on 2.0
fields.summary: Stage view sometimes hides files with changes, potentially causing incomplete commits
Git status error

fields.description:
Hi,

 

I've had this error when i'm starting Sourcetree for the first time :

ERROR [2017-03-30 15:27:49,865] [1] [SourceTree.App] [OnStartup] - Failed to start
System.UnauthorizedAccessException: Attempted to perform an unauthorized operation.

Here my C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree folder content : 

 

!image-2017-03-30-15-35-26-158.png!

 

Do yo Have an idea ? I've no problem with 1.7 sourcetree version

 

 

thanks
fields.summary: Error when starting SourceTree at the first launch

fields.description:
Customer's report:

{quote}
I have split view staging set, flat list with multiple columns. pending files, sorted by path.

File status seems to still have issues holding the sorting. The files seem to jump around. I have my sort order set to path. I have noticed that the files stay sorted by path however they jump around within that path. Perhaps a secondary sort order by name would help (I would actually prefer this as I like to see the files by path but still have the names sorted alphabetically within those paths. I thought v1.x did this thought I could be mistaken). 

There are many instances where not all files staged or unstaged when click stage/unstage all.
{quote}

May have the same root cause as this: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-6903 ?

See video: [^staging-unstaging sort and skipping files issue.mp4]
fields.summary: SourceTree seems to not sort by path as expected.

fields.description:
If you click on the "select all" tick box SourceTree will try to individually add each modified file, and pops up a new progress window for each file. You can't view full output in the window because they disappear quickly. It would be better if only one progress window popped up and all log operations were appended to that one window.

 

!st.gif!
fields.summary: Can't view command full log output when selecting multiple files
push/pull progress bar with correct value and time left
Remove blank lines from the console's full output

fields.description:
# Go to Repository Settings > Advanced
 # Check "Use global user settings". Name and email change to global values 
 # Press OK
 # Go to Repository Settings > Advanced
 # "Use global user settings" is now unchecked. 

This is just a visual problem. The repo details do update if the global ones are changed.
fields.summary: Repository Settings: "Use global user settings" not remembered

fields.description:
In SourceTree 1.10.x, there was branch/tag information in the Log view's summary of the selected commit. In SourceTree 2.0.x this information is missing.

When a commit has a lot of tags (which it gets from our CI system), it is not possible to see the branches anymore in the table view:

!image-2017-03-28-10-15-22-546.png!

Maybe the branches can be listed first?

Furthermore, we would like to copy/paste the tag information for the commit, which was possible from the commit summary in SourceTree 1.10.x.
fields.summary: Branch/tag info missing in Log view

fields.description:
I suggest to keep Remotes syncing with server. For example, branch feature/aaa was deleted from server, but you can always see it from source tree Remotes section. 

This will introduce unnecessary trouble for developers.
fields.summary: Keep REMOTES sync with BitBucket server

fields.description:

For below repository. 

svn://svn.devops.apmoller.net/maerskwas/svn/repositories/soa_workflow

fields.description: Monospaced font is more clear when reading command output, especially if ASCII art is attempted

Large font configured in PC are causing text in sourcretree to be so large to be point it is not readable.

fields.description:
# Add an existing Mercurial project to SourceTree.
 # Modify some files in the project.
 # Select one of the modified files in the pending list.
 # Click the tick box.
 # Observe that a window pops up, then disappears.
 # Observe that the file is no longer checked and cannot be committed.
fields.summary: Can't commit files in a Mercurial repository

fields.description:
I had created about 10 git repositories and dragged them into 4 folders.

1. The opening of application and startup tab is slow (about 20 seconds).
	Opening and other operating on tabs of an individual repository is fast, so I think it is not performance issue come from my PC. 
	Maybe develop team should not let startup tab check status for repositories, I found the tab show current branch of each repository, so I think it scan them! 
	Of course, some of my repositories are hugfe (both in history or size).

2. No hierarchical fodler, I use folder hierarchy to manage levels of repository for years. I think it is an good feature, why remove it in new version?
fields.summary: Bad performance on startup folders, and no embedded folders

fields.description:
This doesn't happen in SourceTree Mac - the file remains unresolved. I guess SourceTree is detecting the merge markers are still there. 

It's easy to work around using "Mark Unresolved", but I'm setting severity to Major because if you don't notice what's happened, it's easy to commit a conflicted file by accident.
fields.summary: Quitting external merge tool without saving marks the file as resolved

fields.description:
SourceTree 2.0.13-beta-1 silently crashes on launch when there are invalid dictionary files; following stack trace has been produced:
\{code:java}
ERROR [2017-03-20 10:41:20,630] [1] [SourceTree.App] [OnStartup] - Failed to start
System.ArgumentException: Cannot set Owner property to itself.
   at System.Windows.Window.set_Owner(Window value)
   at SourceTree.Notifications.NotificationsManager.ShowNotificationDialog[T](NotificationDialogWindow notificationWindow, Tuple`2 customAction, VistaTaskDialogIcon icon)
   at SourceTree.Notifications.NotificationsManager.ShowNotificationDialog[T](String title, String message, Tuple`2 customAction, String cancelLabel, String suppressionSetting, Action`1 suppressionChangedAction, Object contentControl, String contentCommandLabel, Action contentAction)
   at SourceTree.Notifications.NotificationsManager.ShowNotificationDialogWithYesConfirmation(String title, String message, String details)
   at SourceTree.Configuration.WpfSpellCheckerPreFlightCheck.Run()
   at SourceTree.AppRoot.RunPreFlightChecks()
   at SourceTree.AppRoot.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs e)
   at SourceTree.App.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs e)
DEBUG [2017-03-20 10:41:20,633] [3] [SourceTree.Instances.SingleInstance] [PipeConnectionReceived] - SingleInstance pipe connection received
DEBUG [2017-03-20 10:41:20,637] [3] [SourceTree.Instances.SingleInstance] [StartServer] - SingleInstance waiting for connection: iar is not null\{code}

Opening an earlier version of SourceTree (eg. 1.9.10 or even Beta 12) will pop up the Invalid Dictionaries-dialog, after confirming the popup, ST 2.0.13 boots as usual.
fields.summary: Sourcetree fails to launch on invalid dictionaries

fields.description:
I created a new Git repo for an existing directory containing code. Before initial check in, I want to add some folders to .gitignore. However the right hand side of the File Status view seems to get stuck on a file within the first sub-directory, so that when I select other directories that file is always shown, or if I click on a file I get both with the 'stuck file' first. (see attachment 'pic1')

Now, when I right click on a directory to choose Ignore..., the options I get pertain to the stuck file, not the directory I selected (see attachment pic2). Therefore I cannot (for example) add the Debug directory to .gitignore using the UI.

Closing the repository and re-opening from the bookmarks doesn't help, the file is still stuck.
fields.summary: File status view gets stuck on a particular file

fields.description:
# Maximize SourceTree
 # Attempt to drag the window using the title bar

Expected result: window unmaximizes and lets you drag it

Actual result: nothing happens

Compare and contrast with, say, Notepad.
fields.summary: Sourcetree window drag behaviour is wrong when maximized

fields.description:
# Launch SOurceTree
 # Give window focus
 # Give another window focus

Expected results: the SourceTree window looks visibly different when it doesn't have focus

Actual results: it looks the same

This makes working with a tiled-like window arrangement (i.e., all windows are visible all the time) this makes it too easy to get Alt+Tab wrong and end up sending keypresses to the wrong window.

Please at least make SourceTree respect the accent colour, which you can activate like this:
 # Go to Personalization in the control panel
 # Click the Colour button at the bottom
 # Select an obvious accent colour then set "Show colour on title bar" to ON (then if you try clicking on other windows, you should see the effect)
fields.summary: SourceTree window looks the same whether it has focus or not

fields.description: During an external merge, the "Visual Merge In Progress" dialog is shown. Pressing "Abort" returns control to SourceTree as expected. But when I exit the merge tool (without saving), SourceTree marks the file as resolved anyway. It should surely leave it as resolved if Abort was pressed.
fields.summary: External merge: Abort doesn't work

fields.description:
While doing an external merge, the entire SourceTree app is disabled until the merge tool exits. This is unfortunate; it's often necessary to examine the history of the branches involved in the merge when deciding what the result should be, but this is impossible with the current behaviour. 
Ideally we would be able continue to use SourceTree during a merge. But if you really feel it's necessary to disable SourceTree, at least limit it to disabling the current tab, so we can access other repos.
fields.summary: "Visual Merge In Progress" dialog blocks whole app

fields.description:
# Switch to the File Status tab
# Paste a file name into the search box above the diff view

The "Show only" combo changes to "All files", as expected. 
But the file list is unfiltered, as if the search box was empty. 
Editing the pasted text forces the file list to update.
fields.summary: Pasting into File Status search box doesn't filter files

fields.description: It would be nice to have an option to enable automatic pushing after a merge. I frequently merge a commit on the {{dev}} branch to the {{production}} branch when I release a new version, and I have to push after this.
fields.summary: Option - Push automatically after merge

fields.description:
When using the feature "Log selected > Reset to commit..." the file will not roll back to the previous version if it's tracked by LFS:

!lfs reset to commit.gif!
fields.summary: When using the feature "Log selected > Reset to commit..." the file will not roll back to the previous version if it's tracked by LFS.

fields.description: When no updates are available, the updates tab in the Options dialog is missing a space between "up" and "to" in "SourceTree is upto date."
fields.summary: typo in Updates tab of Options

fields.description: Only the first custom action seems to show up in the context menu when right-clicking on a file.  The full set is only visible from the Actions->Custom Actions menu.
fields.summary: Custom actions not all displayed from context menu

fields.description:
It would be helpful if the local branches indicated one of three possible states:
 # Local branch has never had a remote
 # Local branch is tracking an existing remote
 # Local branch is tracking a remote that has been deleted

It would drastically simplify cleanup of local branches after PRs are merged and the remote branches deleted. It would also help visually see what has been pushed to others.
fields.summary: Local branches should indicate whether they are tracking a remote

fields.description:
The specific circumstance for this issue is that I was merging a branch which reported a conflict.  While the merge changes were still uncommitted, I was unable to view differences on files that were merged successfully.  The screenshot before the merge commit shows one of these files selected, and ST will not display diff info, nor would it allow me to open an external diff.  The screenshot after the commit shows the same file selected, and I am able to view differences both in ST and externally without issue.

I had this happen at least once before (in an earlier 2.x beta), and if I remember correctly, that was also during a merge or rebase where there were conflicts to resolve.  In that instance, I really needed to confirm the merged changes, so my only solution was close the ST beta and open the earlier release version.  I never encountered this problem prior to the 2.x betas.

This might be related to SRCTREEWIN-6967, though the circumstances described there are different.

[UPDATE] I replicated this issue twice this morning.  Both times, I was doing a merge, and there were merge conflicts to be resolved.  I could view diff info for the files that HAVE a conflict, but I could not view a diff for the files that do NOT have a conflict.
fields.summary: No diff view during merge
Grammar mistake in error message

fields.description:
After fetch or checkout branches tree gets collapsed. A few clicks on arrows are required to open its "folders". In the video attached you can see that immediately after fetch the current branch name is not even displayed. You click on the folder arrow twice and the whole folder content is empty. You click two more times and the content is displayed completely, including the items hidden after fetch.

This happends about 5 or 6 months so far.
fields.summary: Branches tree behavior is weird

fields.description:
{quote}If I try to commit to the repository without entering a message then SourceTree hangs after I click the Commit button. 
The application does not respond and I have to kill the process using Task Manager. 
I would need to re-open SourceTree to commit with a message in order to proceed.

I agree, best practice is to always specify a message so I "technically" shouldn't be running into this if I were doing that. But I don't always do that for POC hobby projects where I'm just wanting to get a backup of my file in the repo quick and move on with life.
{quote}
-- STSP-5787
fields.summary: Periodically hangs when commit without message
Git's Split view staging affects Mercurial committing

fields.description:
# Change a file so that only 1 hunk in that file is changed
 # Use the Stage hunk button to stage that hunk
 # When the file appears in the Staged files list, click on it to get a diff

Expected results: you get a diff

Actual results: you get a diff, then SourceTree updates a second or so later, and the diff vanishes, never to return. The only way to get it back is to unstage the file and stage it again. Very distracting
fields.summary: Sometimes there's no diff after staging a hunk

fields.description:
# Load repo with submodules
 # Click one of the submodules in the left hand panel thing to view it

Expected result: submodule opens in new tab; submodule opens in existing tab and there's a back button so you can get back where you were; something else sensible (etc.)

Actual result: nothing like that - the submodule replaces what was in the tab before, and you can't go back

(I'm sure I've got into this situation mid-commit as well, when it turns out there's a change in a submodule - it's really maddening)
fields.summary: Opening a submodule replaces current tab

fields.description:
Prior versions used to open a submodule in a new tab, which allowed for an easy workflow between parent project and submodule.

2.0 opens the submodule in the same view as the parent project, essentially closing it. This means you have to open it again in a new tab.
fields.summary: Submodules replace the current project view when opened
"Refresh automatically when files change" option not working

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Recently, [Locking feature|https://github.com/git-lfs/git-lfs/blob/master/docs/proposals/locking.md] seems to be released in Git LFS. SourceTree doesn't currently support the feature.

h3. Suggested Solution

Please support the feature in SourceTree.
fields.summary: Support for Locking feature of Git LFS

fields.description: I'm using SourceTree on a laptop with Windows 10, 1920x1080 screen resolution, and the "Size of text, apps and other items" set to 125%. As seen on the attached screenshot, the icons on the sidebar don't resize properly and overlap with the text.
fields.summary: Icons overlapping with text when text size set to 125%

fields.description:
I work on a lot of different git repos.  I have them organized into the repo folders. A feature I wish for is some kind of "repos tab group" feature to switch between them (similar to Firefox's tab groups).

Since ST already has the repo folders, perhaps adding these or similar features will accomplish it:
 # Close all open repo tabs.
 # Open all repos in a folder/group.
 # Or some combination to do it in one click.
fields.summary: Switch between groups of open repos

fields.description: Partly staging a file then discarding from the staged file area will discard unstaged changes as well.
fields.summary: Discarding a partly staged file will also discard unstaged changes

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

Create new git project from local directory with a folder in it (don't commit)

Switch to tree view

Right click unstaged folder and click "Show in Explorer"

Make sure to save your work, I haven't been able to stop new explorer windows opening before the OS becomes unresponsive and eventually crashes.
fields.summary: "Show in Explorer" can open infinite explorer windows, compromising OS stability
SourceTree really slow on windows 10 with antivirus on

fields.description: When there are a lot of changed files (i.e. 800+), pressing the Stage All button does not add all files to the staging area. The same is true for unstaging.
fields.summary: Stage All and Unstage All does not add or remove all files

fields.description:
There are multiple ways to reproduce this, but the easiest is to stage a file from the split view, then quickly (within a second or so) select the file in the staged list, showing the diff of the file. A moment later Sourcetree appears to "refresh," clearing the diff view but leaving the staged file selected in the list.

In order to bring back the diff, you need to deselect, then re-select the file. If it is the only file in the list, this requires a ctrl+click to deselect. Bit annoying, happens fairly frequently when I am preparing commits.
fields.summary: In split-view, after staging a file and quickly selecting that file, the diff view will clear itself

fields.description: Extended integration for remotes is not saved correctly at least since the first 2.0 beta, and gets removed on exit. It needs to be reconfigured after every restart.
fields.summary: Extended Integration information not saved

fields.description:
{quote}The stash command is
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false stash save <message>

This causes an issue when the stash message begins with a dash, e.g. my most recent message attempt "-P5":

\{code:java}

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false stash save -P5
error: unknown option for 'stash save': -P5
 To provide a message, use git stash save -- '-P5'
usage: git stash list [<options>]
 or: git stash show [<stash>]
 or: git stash drop [-q|--quiet] [<stash>]
 or: git stash ( pop | apply ) [--index] [-q|--quiet] [<stash>]
 or: git stash branch <branchname> [<stash>]
 or: git stash [save [--patch] [-k|--[no-]keep-index] [-q|--quiet]
 [-u|--include-untracked] [-a|--all] [<message>]]
 or: git stash clear
\{code}

To fix this just include the -- in the options.
{quote}
--STSP-6150
fields.summary: Add -- to stash save
External Diff doesn't work for renamed files

fields.description:
# Modify a file in submodule
 # Modify a file in main repo
 # In main repo, stage and commit
 # "Submodule Check" dialog appears; click Open...
 # Check "Push changes immediately" checkbox
 # In submodule, stage and commit

If the push fails because of upstream changes, the app becomes unresponsive with no way to recover except to restart.
fields.summary: Submodule Check: app hangs when push fails

fields.description:
# Modify a file in submodule
# Modify a file in main repo
# In main repo, stage and commit 
# "Submodule Check" dialog appears; click Open...
# In submodule, stage and commit

The submodule and main repo are both committed, as expected. But the submodule gitlink file (containing the current submodule commit hash) is still uncommitted. 
A message appears about trying to commit with no staged changes. 

The gitlink file should surely be part of the same commit, otherwise what's the point of this feature?
fields.summary: Submodule Check: gitlink file not included in commit

fields.description: I have attached a screenshot the cancel button should say "ok" or "restart" to be honest not sure if it updated or I cancelled it.
fields.summary: Source tree told me to update, i said yes then I get a please restart with a cancel. My i was confused while drinking my coffee haha.

fields.description:
When attempting to update, I recieve the below error:
 the downloaded update size does not match the size specified in updates configuration file
I get past the option where I choose the update, it says the size, waits a little bit and then comes back with that.

See: [STSP-5987|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-5987]
fields.summary: Unable to update

fields.description:
I have one repository that is always showing "Uncommitted changes" on the Log / History view, even though nothing shows in the list of pending files (see screenshot).  This is only true in the 2.0.x betas -- in the 1.9.x release SourceTree does not indicate that there are any changes.  All the other repos I've opened in the beta display correctly.  This is my largest repo, and has a lot of ignored files, so possibly that has something to do with it?  If you need more info, or if there is something you want me to try, let me know.

!ScreenShot 2017-03-02 14 19 22.png!
fields.summary: Screen says "Uncommited changes" when there are none

fields.description: When I installed the 2.0.7.1 beta, none of the bookmarks from the 1.9.x release were migrated to the beta.  I had 3 folders defined, and several repositories bookmarks under each one.  I had to re-enter them all in the beta.
fields.summary: Bookmarks not migrated to beta from release version

fields.description:
Scenario:

I keep all my git repos on the host Mac but because of some build dependencies, I need to put one on the windows VM. I cloned the repo with ST to a place on the virtual C: drive and everything looks good for about 10s. After that, ST seems to lose track of the repo. (The error message I get is git complaining about not finding a git repo, screenshot below). Browsing to that location on the command line, it no longer identifies as a git repo but the source files are still there.

 

However, cloning a new repo via command line works as expected. Doing a comparison of the cmd line only repo with one that ST had accessed. The ST one is missing the .git/config file.

 

Environment:

macOS Sierra 10.12.3

Windows 10

Parallels 12 for Mac
fields.summary: Source Tree breaks git repo on VM

fields.description: In Repository Settings, on the Advanced tab, I define a commit text link for our JIRA server.  When I installed the 2.0.7.1 beta of SourceTree, this commit text link was not preserved, and I had to re-enter it for the repository.  It appears that SourceTree is deleting this setting in the beta, because every time I have closed and re-opened the beta so far, the commit text link is always gone again.  This is still true with the current 2.0.11.1 beta. If I go back the 1.9.10.0 release after running the beta, I have to re-enter the commit text link.
fields.summary: Commit text links not preserved

fields.description: E.g. Actions > Resolve Conflicts.
fields.summary: Submenus not highlighted on mouse over

fields.description: I guess it's looking for .git/config, but it needs to follow the .git file to find the "real" .git directory.
fields.summary: Repository Settings > Edit Config File doesn't work in worktree

fields.description: Although there are unstaged changes, the Stash action is not immediately available. To enable it, I have to stage a file and then select it in the Staged Files list.
fields.summary: Stash button not enabled

fields.description: We added subtrees with the help of SourceTree, but now when my colleagues clone the branch they are not shown the subtrees. The sidebar part where they are shown to me is empty at their computers. So they cant push/pull from/to the subtree. Please help us.
fields.summary: Subtrees not showing up

fields.description:
I can do everything in the beta (checkout, pull, stash, etc) but I *can't* push to remote repo (remote folder / bare repo).

 
{panel:title=Output}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=manager-st push -v origin feature/TEC:feature/TEC
 Pushing to //svrFilesDr/git$/AbfSources.git
 remote: error: object directory /svrFilesDr/git$/AbfSources.git/objects does not exist; check .git/objects/info/alternates.        
 remote: fatal: unresolved deltas left after unpacking        

error: unpack failed: unpack-objects abnormal exit
 To //svrFilesDr/git$/AbfSources.git
  ! [remote rejected]   feature/TEC -> feature/TEC (unpacker error)
 error: failed to push some refs to '//svrFilesDr/git$/AbfSources.git'

Completed with errors, see above.
{panel}
 

I tried to delete my local repo and did a new checkout but same error. I have to use pre-2.0 release to push to remote.
fields.summary: Can't push to remote repo
